Conclusion:

Ethereum hasn‚Äôt led all year, but it doesn‚Äôt need to.

Cycles always start with Bitcoin, and then capital rotates.
The rotation is already visible in ETF flows, whale accumulation, and on-chain activity.

And when that rotation accelerates, ETH is positioned for the sharpest upside

This time, ETH has:

‚óè ETFs creating a steady pipeline of buyers

‚óè Treasuries & DAOs holding ETH like reserves

‚óè Ultra sound money dynamics after the Merge

‚óè On-chain demand across DeFi, RWAs, NFTs, staking

This isn‚Äôt hype.
It‚Äôs structural and it‚Äôs why $10K ETH fits into this cycle.

And this is why $10,000 ETH is realistic.

At ~$4,300 today, it would take just a little over a 2√ó move.

That‚Äôs modest compared to the last cycles, 15√ó in 2017 and 60√ó from the 2020 lows to the 2021 peak.

But this cycle isn‚Äôt about wild multiples. It‚Äôs about stronger foundations.

Now let's put it all together:

‚óè 6.7M ETH in ETFs

‚óè 4.7M ETH in treasuries and DAOs

‚óè Exchange reserves drained by 10M ETH since 2021

‚óè 5.5M ETH accumulated by whales since April

‚óè 35.7M ETH staked 

‚óè Net supply growth near zero since the Merge

‚óè 6M ETH lost forever while 36M ETH held by long-term holders

‚óè Every chart, every datapoint, points to the same conclusion.

Ethereum is entering a supply shock.

But that's not all.

‚û∫ Talking about RWA or DeFi, Ethereum still has the highest TVL with 50%+ market share.

‚û∫ Even the US government announced to put its economic data on Ethereum, while Chinese-state owned firm deployed digital bond on it.

‚û∫ Whether it's institutions, governments or big companies; Ethereum remains the #1 choice.

‚ùª Rising Network activity

‚û∫ When Ethereum network activity rises, ETH burn amount goes up too.

‚û∫ Last month, Ethereum did $69B in perps volume while DEX volume hit $140B, its highest level ever.

‚ù∫ Individual whales loading

‚û∫ Whale wallets holding between 1,000 and 100,000 ETH have been buying heavily since April.

‚û∫ In just five months, they‚Äôve added 5.5M ETH, a 14% increase in holdings.

‚û∫ Their collective balance now sits above 45M ETH.

‚û∫ This isn‚Äôt retail chasing green candles, this is serious money who sees a big potential in ETH.

‚ùπ ETH Burn

‚û∫ Since the Merge in 2022, Ethereum‚Äôs net supply has barely moved.

‚û∫ Roughly 2M ETH has been burned, while 2.5M ETH was issued. Net change: just half a million ETH.

‚û∫ That‚Äôs +0.14% per year supply growth.

‚û∫ For context, under Proof-of-Work, ETH supply would have increased by 12.26 million, a 25x increase.

‚û∫ This structural shift is why people call ETH "ultra sound money."

‚ù∏ Exchange Supply

‚û∫ Back in 2021, exchanges held almost 29M ETH.

‚û∫ Since 2022, ETH reserves on exchanges have fallen from ~28.5M to ~17.3M, a drop of more than 11M ETH. 

‚û∫ Every ETH that leaves an exchange is removing an imminent selling pressure.

‚û∫ It‚Äôs the clearest signal of a tightening float.

‚ù∑ Companies buying

‚û∫ It‚Äôs not only ETFs.

‚û∫ Treasuries, DAOs, and corporate entities have added another 4.7M ETH worth $20B since April.

‚û∫ That‚Äôs another 3.9% of supply effectively locked.

‚û∫ Put ETFs and entities together, and nearly 9.5% of the entire supply has been removed from circulation in less than a year.
